item.title: Helldivers 2: Into the Unjust will launch on September 2nd
item.content:encoded:
Arrowhead has announced that the Helldivers will have a new objective to deal with from September 2nd, which is when Helldivers 2: Into the Unjust will launch. These new missions will take players deep into the Terminid Hive Worlds where there will be new missions to beat, and new enemies to push back in locations that will be creeping with all sorts of creatures.

The Hive Worlds have been shrouded by the Gloom, so it is time to lift the veil and shoot at whatever is hidden by it. Locations will include huge towers to scale and caverns deep underground where you and your squad could be hit at any time. Arrowhead has stated that when you are in the caverns there will be no Super Destroyer support, meaning it is just your squad and whatever weapons you can carry. Some of the new creatures that will be encountered on the Hive Worlds include variants of Terminid Warriors and Bile Spewers, along with Chargers that will dig underground and emerge in front of its enemies, aka you. There is also the new Dragonroach creature which flies and fires down burning bile. Arrowhead has stated there are other creatures which players will discover for themselves. The new missions include escorting an oil rig across the planet’s surface, and destroying Hive Lungs in the caverns below. New additional objectives will be added to Helldivers 2 for Into the Unjust too.

The Dust Devils Premium Warbond will also be available from September 2nd, and it will include:

    • G-7 Pineapple – This cluster frag grenade might look like a cute and unassuming fruit, but it’ll have the bugs in absolute pieces.
    • S-11 Speargun – A true big game hunter’s companion. The S-11 fires heavy-duty projectiles that release a cloud of gas on impact.
    • EAT-700 Expendable Napalm – Heat up the planet with this single-use missile that contains napalm cluster bombs.
    • MS-11 Solo Silo – The long-range power of a missile in a new convenient package. Calls down a Hellpod-sized missile silo with a single, ultra-powerful missile and a handheld targeting remote.

    • DS-42 Federation’s Blade – Captures the essence of armies marching through the desert sands. Wear with the Rightful occupier cape and player card for a polished look.

    • DS-191 Scorpion- Look like a true nomadic warrior in this desert-proof draped set, pairs perfectly with the Windswept Wayfinder cape and player card.

    • Title: Burier of Heads
    • Emote: Raider’s Cheer
    • Pattern: “Rattlesnake” for vehicles and Hellpods

Source: YouTube/PS Blog



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/08/26/helldivers-2-into-the-unjust-will-launch-on-september-2nd/
